title: Inside the lavish state dinner with Australia, the Trumps' second such formal evening at the White House
text:
REUTERS/Joshua Roberts Guests attend a state dinner hosted by US President Donald Trump for Australia’s Prime Minister Scott Morrison in the Rose Garden of the White House on September 20, 2019.

President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump hosted their second state dinner on Friday night, in honour of the prime minister of Australia.

A bevy of DC heavyweights turned out for the event, including Cabinet members, diplomats, one Supreme Court justice, Fox News hosts, CEOs, lawmakers, and a couple minor celebrities.

The menu for the evening featured ravioli, summer vegetables, fish, and apple tart. Musical groups from the US Army, Marine Corps, Navy, and Air Force provided the entrainment.

Visit Business Insider’s homepage for more stories.

The White House Rose Garden was transformed for a formal gas lamp-lit dinner for about 200 people on Friday night.

President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump hosted their second state dinner, in honour of Australia’s Prime Minister Scott Morrison and his wife Jenny. Their first was for French President Emmanuel Macron and his wife Brigitte in April 2018.

State dinners are time-honoured traditions dictated by specific protocol. They always start with a formal greeting on the White House lawn, then a joint press conference, diplomatic meetings, and end with a lavish dinner for hundreds.

Here’s what the decor looked like, what was on the menu, and who attended the Trumps’ second state dinner.

The Trumps greeted the guests of honour, the Morrisons, at the North Portico of the White House. State dinners are meant to highlight diplomatic relations between the two countries, and each detail is selected to show that.

REUTERS/Joshua Roberts U.S. President Donald Trump and U.S. first lady Melania Trump pose with Australia’s Prime Minister Scott Morrison and his wife Jenny Morrison ahead of a state dinner at the White House in Washington, D.C. on September 20, 2019.

The dress code is formal black tie. The first lady was wearing a $US6,000 aqua silk chiffon J. Mendel gown with “bias-cut wave ruffles.”

REUTERS/Joshua Roberts U.S. President Donald Trump and U.S. first lady Melania Trump greet Australia’s Prime Minister Scott Morrison and his wife Jenny Morrison as they arrive for a state dinner at the White House in Washington, D.C. on September 20, 2019.

Sources: Kate Bennett, White House Fashion

Members of the armed forces were on hand with flags and instruments to participate in the formal welcoming ceremonies, seen here in the Grand Foyer of the White House.

ALEX EDELMAN/AFP/Getty Images US President Donald Trump and First Lady Melania Trump (R) pose with Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison (2nd L) and wife Jenny Morrison (L) for an Official Visit with a State Dinner in the Grand Foyer of the White House in Washington, DC, September 20, 2019.

The guests started arriving for the evening. Vice President Mike Pence and second lady Karen Pence wore matching black.

AP Photo/Patrick Semansky Vice President Mike Pence, right, and his wife Karen Pence arrive for a State Dinner with Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison and President Donald Trump at the White House, Friday, Sept. 20, 2019, in Washington.

Counselor to the president Kellyanne Conway attended the evening solo without her husband George Conway, who is a frequent critic of Trump. She was wearing a $US798 black feather-embellished Mac Duggal gown.

AP Photo/Patrick Semansky Counselor to the President Kellyanne Conway arrives for a State Dinner with Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison and President Donald Trump at the White House, Friday, Sept. 20, 2019, in Washington.

Source: White House Fashion

Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas was there with his wife Virginia Thomas. He was the only SCOTUS justice to attend.

AP Photo/Patrick Semansky Supreme Court Associate Justice Clarence Thomas, right, and wife Virginia Thomas arrive for a State Dinner with Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison and President Donald Trump at the White House, Friday, Sept. 20, 2019, in Washington.

Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross and his wife Hilary Geary Ross arrived arm-in-arm.

AP Photo/Patrick Semansky Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross, left, and wife Hilary Geary Ross arrive for a State Dinner with Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison and President Donald Trump at the White House, Friday, Sept. 20, 2019, in Washington.

Former US Secretary of State Henry Kissinger and his wife Nancy were there, too.

ALASTAIR PIKE/AFP/Getty Images Former US Secretary of State Henry Kissinger (C) and his wife Nancy (R) arrive in the Booksellers area of the White House to attend a state dinner honouring Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison, in Washington, DC, on September 20, 2019.

Education Secretary Betsy DeVos arrived with her husband Richard. She wore a $US5,500 Pamela Roland pearl-embroidered gown.

Paul Morigi/Getty Images Education Secretary Betsy DeVos, left, and husband Richard DeVos arrive for the State Dinner at The White House honouring Australian PM Morrison on September 20, 2019 in Washington, DC.

Source: White House Fashion

Senior White House adviser Stephen Miller arrived arm-in-arm with Katie Waldman, VP Pence’s press secretary. The two are rumoured to be dating.

REUTERS/Erin Scott White House adviser Stephen Miller arrives with Katie Waldman for a State Dinner for Australia’s Prime Minister Scott Morrison at the White House on September 20, 2019.

Source: Nick Miroff

Golfer Greg Norman and his wife Kirsten Kutner were in attendance. When a reporter asked about people criticising how often Trump golfs, Norman said, “Nobody can golf too much.”

Paul Morigi/Getty Images Golfer Greg Norman (R) and wife Kirsten Kutner arrive for the State Dinner at The White House honouring Australian PM Morrison on September 20, 2019 in Washington, DC. Trump hosted the Australian leader with an arrival ceremony and joint press conference earlier in the day.

US Attorney General William Barr and his wife Christine smiled for the cameras.

Paul Morigi/Getty Images US Attorney General William Barr (R) and Christine Barr arrive for the State Dinner at The White House honouring Australian PM Morrison on September 20, 2019 in Washington, DC. Trump hosted the Australian leader with an arrival ceremony and joint press conference earlier in the day.

Rudy Giuliani, Trump’s personal lawyer, attended the state dinner with date Maria Ryan. He is currently in the middle of a messy divorce with his third wife.

ALASTAIR PIKE/AFP/Getty Images Former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani (L) and Maria Ryan arrive in the Booksellers area of the White House to attend an Official Visit with a State Dinner honouring Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison, in Washington, DC, on September 20, 2019.

Source: The New York Times

Other notable attendees included Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin, Australian chef Curtis Stone, Fox News hosts Lou Dobbs and Maria Bartiromo, CEO of Fox Corporation Lachlan Murdoch, and Chick-fil-A CEO Dan Cathy.

ALASTAIR PIKE/AFP/Getty Images US Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin (C) walks towards the Booksellers area of the White House prior to a state dinner honouring Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison, in Washington, DC, on September 20, 2019.

Once everyone was gathered in the Rose Garden, Trump and Morrison both gave toasts highlighting the US and Australia’s 101-year relationship, and the guests tucked into dinner.

ALEX EDELMAN/AFP/Getty Images US President Donald Trump speaks alongside Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison during an Official Visit with a State Dinner at the White House in Washington, DC, September 20, 2019.

The menu for the evening featured ravioli, summer vegetables, fish, and apple tart.

AP Photo/Alex Brandon A table is set during a media preview for the State Dinner with President Donald Trump and Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison in the Rose Garden of the White House, Thursday, Sept. 19, 2019, in Washington.

This is only the second state dinner held in the Rose Garden. Former President Barack Obama and first lady Michelle Obama hosted one for Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany and her husband in 2011.

REUTERS/Yuri Gripas A table is set with floral arrangements and place settings for the Trump administration’s state dinner with Australia on Friday in the Rose Garden of the White House in Washington, U.S., September 19, 2019.

Musical groups from the US Army, Marine Corps, Navy, and Air Force provided the entrainment, which the first lady’s office said was the largest gathering of military musicians in White House history.

REUTERS/Joshua Roberts A band plays as U.S. President Donald Trump, U.S. first lady Melania Trump, Australia’s Prime Minister Scott Morrison and his wife Jenny Morrison arrive for a state dinner in the Rose Garden of the White House on September 20, 2019.

With the temperature around 69 degrees Fahrenheit, it looked like a lovely evening for a state dinner in the White House Rose Garden.

ALEX EDELMAN/AFP/Getty Images US President Donald Trump speaks alongside Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison during an Official Visit with a State Dinner at the Rose Garden of the White House in Washington, DC, September 20, 2019.
